Probate
 The rich man died,
 His widow cried
 How much did he leave?
 His lawyer Phil
 Said he left a will,
 Here's what you'll receive.
 
 His land and trees ,
 After lawyers fees,
 Will pay to put him down.
 But In his stash
 There is no cash,
 And the bank is sniffin round.
 
 His farm and stock
 Are all in hock,
 And the note is overdue.
 And there survives
 Three other wives
 Who I'm sure will sue.
 
 The house on shore
 Is his no more,
 He had to make the sale.
 His bonds and stocks
 Fell like rocks,
 When his broker went to jail.
 
 There is no yacht,
 I kid you not.
 It sank out in the bay.
 And you can't fly,
 I'll tell you why,
 The jet has flown away.
 
 And the limousine
 Has left the scene,
 But it was only leased.
 And all the bills
 For all the frills
 Are paid by the deceased.
 
 The silverware
 You'll find no where.
 The same goes for the dishes.
 So I believe 
 What you'll receive
 Is naught but his best wishes.
 
 Dono-06
